Mode for Wing Ship Indicators

-Custom Mode: Wing Shield and Middle Symbol at Top will take Custom Color, Wing Hull and Top Icon will take XML Color

-XML Mode: All will take XML Color (Note: The Red 'Shield Down' will also be affected by the XML)

Elements.Description: Brightness for Wing Shields (will also affect the Selection Triangles if Ship is Targeted)

Elements.Description: Wing Hull and Small Icon Brightness

Elements.Title: Target Rank Icon
Elements.Description: Rank Icon that appears next to Targeted Neutral Ship (Orange Only)

Also includes Friendly, Hostile and Crewmate Target Elements
Rhombus, Triangle Holo, Text

Elements.Title: Destination Target Circle

Custom Color for Possible Destination Target and Relative Mouse Arrow (*Alpha)

Opacity Boost in SRV

A Booster for the SRV has been added as the Grey Rhombus on a Planetary Surface is Very Weak

Elements.Description: Mode for Combat Reticles

Elements.Description: Custom Color for Large Tri-Bars (One Vertical at the Top, Two Diagonal at the Bottom) (*Alpha)

Elements.Title: Missile Lock Color
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for Missile Lock (*Alpha)
Out of Range, keeps its Original Red Color

Elements.Title: Mouse Dot Mode
Elements.Description:
Mouse Dot (Ship & SRV)

Note: Relative Mouse Arrow is linked to Possible Destination Target

Elements.Title: Mouse Dot Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for Mouse Dot (Ship & SRV) (*Alpha)

Elements.Title: Remote Release Flak Mode
Elements.Description: Mode for Remote Release Flak / Flechette Launcher

Elements.Title: Remote Release Flak Color
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for Remote Release Flak / Flechette Launcher

Note: The Red Trigger Signal cannot be modded at this time
Brightness controls are not available as it causes a Glitch between the Outer and Proximity Elements
To reduce Brightness, simply reduce your RGB values by the same percentage

Elements.Title: Target Proximity Color
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for Remote Release Flak / Flechette Launcher Target Proximity

Note: The Red Trigger Signal cannot be modded at this time
Brightness controls are not available as it causes a Glitch between the Outer and Proximity Elements
To reduce Brightness, simply reduce your RGB values by the same percentage

Elements.Description: Mode for Analysis Reticles

Elements.Title: Analysis Reticles Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for Analysis Reticles when in Analysis Mode

Elements.Title: Analysis Reticles Brightness
Elements.Description: Brightness for Analysis Reticles when in Analysis Mode

Elements.Title: Custom Color in Combat Mode
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for Analysis Reticles when in Combat Mode (*Alpha)

If you choose an Orange Color or Elite Default Mode, the Analysis Reticles in Combat Mode will use the Missile Lock Color

Elements.Title: Main Text Mode
Elements.Description: Orange Text Color Swap (Majority of Text)

Elements.Title: Main Text Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for Global Text (*Alpha)

Elements.Title: Highlighted Text Mode
Elements.Description: Mode for Highlighted Text in All Panels

Elements.Title: Highlighted Text Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for Highlighted Text in All Panels (*Alpha)

Elements.Title: XML Text Override
Elements.Description:
This will override ALL Text with your XML Color Matrix
Not Recommended

Elements.Title: Secondary Text Mode
Elements.Description: Blue Text Color Swap (around the AHUD and Mission Text, among others)

Elements.Title: Secondary Text Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for Secondary Text (*Alpha)

Elements.Title: Glitching HUD Mode
Elements.Description: The HUD will sometimes Glitch when taking damage, and by Default is Orange

Elements.Title: Mouse Cursor Mode
Elements.Description: Mode for the Mouse Cursor

Elements.Title: Mouse Cursor Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for the Mouse Cursor (*Alpha)

Elements.Title: Lower Panel Lines Mode
Elements.Description: Mode for Lower Panel Lines

Elements.Title: Lower Panel Lines Color
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for Lower Panel Lines (*Alpha)

Note: if your Custom Color is Close to Orange, Add a little Blue (eg. 0.1) to avoid a Glitch on the Targeting Panel

The Targeting Panel uses a Color Swap Technique that looks for Blue = 0

Elements.Title: Targeting Panel Mode
Elements.Description:
Mode for Targeting Panel

Speed / Distance / Alignment in Supercruise, excluding Lower Panel Lines and Text Color

If your chosen Color for Supercruise Speed / Distance Elements are Close to Orange (High Red, Medium Green), Add 0.1 Blue to avoid a Glitch

Elements.Title: Correct Target Alignment (Blocks) Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for Correct Target Alignment Blocks, Bar and Indicator Light (Blue Sections in Original Elite)

Elements.Description: Brightness for Correct Target Alignment

Elements.Title: Replace Cyan Elements
Elements.Description:
Option to Replace Cyan Elements on Ship Side Panels

Turning this ON will Color the Cyan Rank Icons & Parts of the Icons on the Nav Panel with your XML, and Cyan Text with your Panel Text Color

It will also change the Color of the Cyan Blocks on the Ship Panel Storage Tab with your Panel XML Color

Elements.Description: Mode for the Mission panels on the Nav Panel, plus Mission Icon on the Mission Selection Screen

Mode for OwnCarrier in Nav Panel

Elements.Description: Brightness for OwnCarrier in Nav Panel

Elements.Title: Ambient Lighting Mode
Elements.Description:
Identical Settings will Render differently depending on the Ship used, so experiment with different Settings to find the best ones to avoid Lighting Overflow

Extended Lighting: Lighting Fix to Cover Orange Lighting in Ships with a 'Long Nose' (eg. FDL) but more likely to cause Lighting Overflow

Elements.Title: Ambient Glow Mode

Cabin Lighting Ambient Glow Mode

** Keep this at Elite Default unless neutralising Lighting for the Cockpit Paint Mod

Enable Cabin Lighting Primary Color Extension
For use on some Ships like the Dolphin
This option will break the Lighting in some Ships like the Mamba

Mode for System Connector Lines and Supercharged Jump Lines

The Brightness will affect All Color Modes (including Default Color)

Elements.Description: Custom Color for GalMap System Z-Axis Lines

Elements.Title: FSS & DSS Mode
Elements.Description: Mode for Full-Spectrum Scanner (FSS) & Detailed Surface Scanner (DSS)

Elements.Title: FSS Gas Giant Icons Mode
Elements.Description:
Replace Orange Gas Giant Icons with the Blue Color corresponding to the FSS before U18.02

This option is Independent and does not require the activation of another setting

Elements.Title: FSS Background Brightness
Elements.Description:
0 = OFF

Note: Setting this value to 0 will also turn OFF the Space Fog Shader (Only while using the FSS/DSS)

Elements.Title: FSS Orbit Lines Brightness
Elements.Description: FDev made the Orbit Lines Too Bright in the FSS, you can reduce the Brightness here

Elements.Title: FSS Scanning Glow Blobs Color
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for FSS Scanning Glow Blobs
The blobs are very sensitive - small values near zero (eg. 0.01) can make a difference

Elements.Title: FSS / DSS Cyan Elements / Main Reticle Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for FSS / DSS Cyan Elements / Main Reticle (*Alpha)

Elements.Title: FSS Centre Circle Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for FSS Centre Circle (*Alpha)

Elements.Title: Glow on Bottom Spectrum Panel Mode
Elements.Description: Mode for Glow on Bottom Spectrum Panel

Elements.Title: Brightness Booster
Elements.Description:
Brightness Multiplier of Glow on Bottom Spectrum Panel

Note: Baseline Brightness is set above, this value multiplies the Baseline Brightness

Elements.Title: FSS Spectrum Selector Mode
Elements.Description:
Mode for FSS Spectrum Selector
This is the Vertical Line you move across the Spectrum Panel to find Signal Sources

Elements.Title: Spectrum Selector Brightness Booster
Elements.Description:
Brightness Multiplier of FSS Spectrum Selector

Note: Baseline Brightness is set above, this value multiplies the Baseline Brightness (except for Default)

Elements.Title: FSS / DSS Text (Cyan Swap Only) Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for FSS / DSS Text (Cyan Swap Only) (*Alpha)

Elements.Title: FSS Mission Icons Mode
Elements.Description:
Replace Orange Mission Icons and Arrows with the Mission Panel Custom Color

This option is Independent and does not require the activation of another setting

Elements.Title: Probe Trail Mode
Elements.Description:
Classic & XML Modes only replaces the Color of the Trail

Boosted Mode replaces the Color and gives a very Luminous Effect to the Trail

Note: DSS must be Closed to Apply the New Settings

Elements.Title: Trail Variation Mode
Elements.Description:
This option reduces the Color Variations of the Probes Trail, it allows to have a more uniform Color

This option works in Classic and Boosted Modes

Elements.Title: Probe Trail Custom Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color (Classic & Boosted Modes)

Elements.Title: Probe Trail Brightness

Custom Color to replace the Orange Squares in the Mining Mini-Games

The Other Squares will apply the XML Color Matrix

Elements.Title: Combat HUD Mode
Elements.Description:
** Combat HUD (CHUD) Mode **

For a Standard CHUD, Set Color 2 RGB(0,0,0) and Fade Strength = 0

For a Single Color Bird-of-Prey CHUD, Set Color 2 RGB(0,0,0) and your preferred Fade Strength (0.7 is a nice balance)

For a Synthwave (Dual-Color) CHUD, Set Color 2 RGB to your preference, and Fade Strenth = 1

Elements.Title: Custom Color 1
Elements.Description: Custom Color for Combat HUD - Color 1 (Top Color)

Elements.Title: Custom Color 1 - Brightness
Elements.Description: Brightness for Color 1 (Top Color)

Elements.Title: Custom Color 2
Elements.Description: Custom Color for Combat HUD - Color 2 (Bottom Color)

Elements.Title: Fade Strength
Elements.Description:
Fade Strength (or Synthwave Color Balance)
> 1 = More Second Color
< 1 = Less Second Color)

Elements.Title: Ammunition Color
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for Combat HUD - Ammunition
Also changes the Color of the Small Weapon-Type Icons around the CHUD and on the Ship Panel, Modules Tab

Elements.Title: Ammunition Brightness
Elements.Description: Brightness for Ammunition

Elements.Title: Analysis HUD Mode
Elements.Description: Mode for Analysis HUD

Elements.Description: Custom Color for Analysis HUD (*Alpha)

Elements.Description: Brightness for Red Elements around the CHUD / AHUD

Elements.Title: Red Text Color Mode

Elements.Description: CHUD / AHUD Red Text, Custom Alpha / Brightness

Mode for Own Shield & Target Shield

Overall Brightness of Own Shield Area

Note: Also works on Elite Default and XML Modes

Overall Brightness of Target Shield Area

Elements.Title: Hull Gauge Mode

Elements.Title: Hull Gauge Brightness

Elements.Title: Caustic Affected Hull Mode
Elements.Description: Mode for Hull Health Blocks when Affected by Caustic, including Target

Elements.Title: Caustic Affected Hull Color

Elements.Title: Holograms Mode
Elements.Description:
Mode for OwnShip & Target Ship Holograms
Also affects Landing Hologram, SRV Hologram, SRV Terrain on Radar

Elements.Title: Own Hologram Color
Elements.Description: Custom Color for OwnShip Hologram and Landing Plate

Elements.Title: Own Hologram Alpha/Opacity
Elements.Description:
OwnShip Hologram Alpha

Mainly affects the Opacity of the Hull in Bright Light
Set to approximately 1.0 to prevent Fade in Bright External Light

You can set this value higher than 1 to make the Hologram very Opaque

Elements.Title: Own Hologram Brightness
Elements.Description:
Brightness for OwnShip Hologram

For Ultra-Tron, set Hologram Brightness Low (eg. 0) and Outer Lines Bloom High (eg. 0.5)

Elements.Title: Own Hologram Bloom
Elements.Description: Bloom / Glow for OwnShip Hologram

Elements.Title: Outer Lines Bloom
Elements.Description:
Outer Lines Bloom / Glow for OwnShip Hologram

Default= 0
This value can be negative, such as -0.5

Elements.Title: Overall Brightness
Elements.Description: Overall Brightness of OwnShip Hologram

Elements.Title: Shimmering Lines
Elements.Description: Switch for OwnShip Hologram Shimmer

Elements.Title: Neutral Target Hologram
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for Neutral Target Hologram

Depends on Hologram Mode

Elements.Title: Neutral Target Brightness
Elements.Description:
Brightness for Neutral Target Hologram

For Ultra-Tron, set Hologram Brightness Low (eg. 0) and Outer Lines Bloom High (eg. 0.5)

Elements.Title: Other Target Hologram Mode
Elements.Description:
Mode for Other Ship Target Hologram
Also includes Friendly, Hostile and Crewmate Target Holograms

Depends on Hologram Mode

Elements.Description: Green Friendly Target Hologram Brightness

Elements.Title: Hostile Target Brightness
Elements.Description: Red Hostile Target Hologram Brightness

Elements.Title: Crewmate Brightness
Elements.Description: Cyan Crewmate Target Hologram Brightness

Elements.Title: Overall Brightness
Elements.Description: Overall Brightness of ALL Target Hologram

Elements.Title: Shimmering Lines
Elements.Description: Switch for Target Hologram Shimmer

Elements.Title: SRV Hologram - Main
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for SRV Hologram (*Alpha)

Depends on Hologram Mode

Elements.Title: SRV Hologram - Small
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for SRV Hologram on the Radar
(*Alpha) (is a % of the Main Hologram Alpha)

Depends on Hologram Mode

Elements.Title: OFF Landing Site Color
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for:
-Ship Hologram when Landing on a Pad
-OR NOT being Aligned when Landing on a Planet

Depends on Hologram Mode

Elements.Title: ON Landing Site Color
Elements.Description:
Custom Color for Ship Hologram, Landing Line and Coaster:
-When the Ship IS Aligned during Landing on a Planet
